author: Vikas Vasudeva
text:
With the Jat organisations threatening to resume their agitation if their demand for quota is not met, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar reiterated on Thursday that the State government was committed to bringing a Bill to grant OBC (Other Backward Class) status to the community.

“A Jat reservation Bill is being drafted after consideration of every aspect and discussion with all stakeholders. This Bill may be introduced in the Vidhan Sabha any day during the ongoing Budget session,” Mr. Khattar told reporters.

The All-India Jat Arakshan Sangharsh Samiti (AIJASS) led by Yash Pal Malik told The Hindu that they would wait till the March 17 deadline set by them before resuming their agitation. Mr. Malik said the Haryana government had invited Jat leaders for talks on March 18 aftern-oon. “Let’s see what comes out of it...,” said Mr. Malik, adding that they would decide on the next mode of action after the meeting.

‘Reservation Bill may be introduced during this Assembly session’
title: Jats to meet Khattar today
